result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. Campbell Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
18 months incarcerated.
Concurrent with: 14 CF 66 and 14 CM 90

superMiscConds.notes: $518.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes:
36 months in prison - 18 months incarcerated and 18 months on extended supervision concurrent to 14 CF 66 and 14 CM 90.
Concurrent with: 14 CF 66 and 14 CM 90

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William R. Campbell in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant William R. Campbell in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 66, 14 CM 90.  Court calls case and recites appearances 10:25 AM.  State global resolution has been reached.  State - 15 CF 147 - nc / 36 mo. prison sentence 18 mo in and 18 mo. ES and costs.  14 CF66 - 36 mo prison / 18 mo in and 18 mo ES and 14 CM 90 - 9 months to all run concurrent with 150 days credit on 14 CM 90 and 14 CF 66 if not paid to be converted.  Atty Gramstrup agrees.  Defendant agrees.  Court questions Atty Poquette.  15 CF 147 - Atty Gramstrup waived reading.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  
15 CF 147 - defendant entered plea of no contest.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State makes further stmt.  Atty Gramstrup addressed the Court.  Defendant addressed the Court.


15 CF 147:   Sentenced to prison 36 months - 18 months in custody with 18 months on extended supervision and costs ordered - concurrent to 14 CF 66 and 14 CM 90

14 CF 66:   36 months prison 18 months in custody and 18 months on ES - to run concurrent with 14 CM 90 and 15 CF 147 - 150 days credit time served

14 CM 90:   9 months in custody to run concurrent with 14 CF 66 and 15 CF 147

Defendant William R. Campbell in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant William R. Campbell in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gramstrup states defendant will waive prelim.  Court advised the defendant as to his right to a preliminary exam.  Court finds defendant has waived right to preliminary hearing finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Defendant William R. Campbell in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant William R. Campbell in custody appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF waives time limits for Preliminary hearing.  Bond Continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Not to be released until he provides an address to the Clerk of Court's Office and/or Sheriff's Office.  To comply with sex offender regulations/rules at the registry.
Not to be released until he provides an address to the Clerk of Court's Office and/or Sheriff's Office.  To comply with sex offender regulations/rules at the registry.

Defendant William R. Campbell in court, in custody via video.  Atty Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State addressed the Court.  Defendant states he is on a probation hold and will be in custody for awhile.  Court to provide Clerk of Court and attorney of current address.  Court advised the defendant as to the charges pending and his rights.  Defendant understands the charges and penalties.  Court advised him as to his right to have any attorney.  Advised him as to his time limits to have a preliminary hearing w/i 10 days if in custody and 20 days if out on bail he can waive the time limits to give himself/attorney more time.  Court questions him as to an Attorney.  Initial appearance is to be adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
